intro: Thesium scoparium, commonly known as the sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dunes. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant has a low, spreading growth habit. Thesium scoparium is adapted to harsh, arid environments and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
